headline: Rolled Dumplings
description: Simple rolled dumplings made with flour, baking powder, milk and shortening. Roll out the dough, cut it into shapes, cook them in some broth, and eat!
name: Rolled Dumplings

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl. Cut in shortening with a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk until a stiff dough forms.
Roll dough on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 1/8 inch. Cut into 1-inch squares, diamonds, or strips.
Bring chicken broth to a boil in a saucepan. Carefully add dumplings and reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover tightly and cook until tender, 8 to 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made them as written and added to my chicken stew. They cooked up exactly as I had hoped. I’ll make these again.
Added extra salt and pepper
yes! this is the one to use for the dumplings. Accessorize it to suit you and your family.

Always a hit. I completely FAIL at “drop” type dumplings, and my husband loves his mom’s. I found this recipe, and he asks for this every time. I sometimes add some herbs, onion, or garlic powder to the mix just to add something extra. Most of the time, I just stick to this basic recipe. I don’t flour my surface, I simply make my dough, let it rest in the fridge wrapped in plastic wrap for an hour (or more), then roll portions of it out between two pieces of parchment paper. Easy clean up.
This was the best recipe! So happy I came across it! Like my grandmother used to make!!
I had difficulty with the dough holding together. It seemed to dry. Not sure what I did. The taste is great.

As far as I'm concerned, these are the true Southern dumplings; just like my granny, Aunt Dola, and great-great granny made. This is the way I make it, too, and I think I'm the only one left in my family who makes them. Let them simmer at a very slow bubbling point. Dumplings cook from the steam, and if you boil them to hard, they will dissolve into your broth.
this one is my go to ! perfect just like my Nammies
I also use this recipe and cook in beef broth from a boiled beef dinner. Delicious!
Exactly the kind of dumplings which my family loves.

Dumplings were delicious. I used half the salt stated. Next time I will use the full amount. Mine did not rise much and I did have to add about 4 or 5 tablespoons extra of milk to get mine into a ball. Great recipe
I was looking for a simple roll out recipe for dumplings to make chicken and dumplings. This fit the bill perfectly! Best dumplings for any recipe.

100%, this is the perfect Southern dumpling recipe. What makes them perfect is the al dente texture. I made them exactly per the recipe, including making sure to roll them extremely thin because they increase by about 30% in thickness.

As mentioned in the instructions, this is a *very* dry dough. I made it in a bowl, then kneaded it a few times, then pressed it into the bottom of the bowl to sit and hydrate while I did other things. It was still very dry, but it rolled out great. Resist the temptation to add more milk, if you do they'll puff up way way bigger and they'll also have a soft undesirable texture.

I'm a huge fan of butter and rarely use shortening for anything, but you absolutely cannot use butter in this recipe.

The one change I made was to use butter flavored Crisco for the shortening.
Dumplings tasted good but most cooked away. I doubled the recipe so not sure what happened.

This is a great recipe. I doubled the recipe. I rolled them out on a paper bag heavily dusted with flour and cut them with a pizza cutter then more flour and gathered them on the lid as a holding place. Then got my broth boiling (added some 1/2&1/2) and gently but as quickly as possible added to the pot. Made sure they were all wet, covered and simmered for about 15 minutes. Walah. Done.
Great recipe to use with left over thanksgiving turkey. We have tons left over because of COVID and did everything from croquettes to casseroles then we used it in here and muah amazing.
Great

This was a great recipe for dumplings!! The best thing I did is I decided to use my Kitchenaid stand mixer with dough hook attachment. After I did a bit of mixing by hand, I let the machine do the rest. Also it freezes well.

I made this tonight for dinner. We had some leftover pork stew I made the day before. This was an excellent addition. I went by the directions, but used lard (yes I said lard) for more flavor and texture plus some Italian seasoning. This will be my go to from now on!
RhondaThomas fairly easy to make my Husband LOVES Them
These dumplings are so quick and easy. I used a vegan butter substitute since I didn't have any shortening. Turned out perfectly.
Rolled very thin and they were delicious! If making a big pot I would do two batches.

These are the rolled dumplings I was looking for!! 
I doubled the recipe ... they turned out perfect.

I've been using this recipe for several years now and it is wonderful. Really easy to make and is always a big hit with my family too. I saute chopped onions, celery, and carrots first then add the chicken broth. Then I add 1 tsp each of dried thyme and rosemary while the dumplings are cooking. Finally I add pulled chicken meat and some fresh ground black pepper. If I don't cook the chicken myself a rotisserie chicken from the supermarket works great. This is my wife's favorite cold weather dish.
I didn't change a thing. Delicious.

I made these for a potluck for our church's game night and was told they were the best they've ever had. My husband even wanted to know what I had done different from my last recipe. Great flavor and texture. The absolute perfect rolled dumpling!

I will make it again. my suggestion is to use pastry dough blender, and don't be rough with the dough once you blend the milk in it. I roll dough between two sheets of parchment paper using rolling pin. I use pizza cutter to cut and then put in freezer a few minutes

I followed the recipe but had to do some finagling. Didn’t have any chicken broth so I took a gamble and used chicken flavored bullion (I know, I know, but I live 30 minutes from the nearest store of any kind). I put celery, carrots , poultry seasoning and rosemary as if I were stewing a hen (Also I used leftover turkey I had froze from Thanksgiving. Let it simmer while I rolled out the dumplings. Brought the broth to a boil, dropped the rolled dumplings in and then covered the pot, turned the heat down to a slow simmer. The family loved it and said it was the best Chicken & Dumplings I’ve ever made. They have/had no idea I used turkey or cheat-a-broth.
Will definitely make this again!

11/27/18: This makes a TON of dumplings. I added it to soup instead of making a more traditional chicken and dumplings. They tended to stick together with leftovers. James REALLY liked these so I'll definitely make them again. Perhaps add seasoning to the dumplings next time?

This recipe is a game-changer for me. I’ve always been a “drop dumpling” maker. My husband grew up eating rolled dumplings. For nine years, I’ve been trying to find a recipe that he likes. He’s incredibly picky. Finally, SUCCESS! I doubled it, and I don’t know how much liquid I used since it was broth from boiling chicken, but I’m sure it was more than double what was called for. Thanks, poster! ??
Easiest and best tasting dumplings. I add them to my Chicken and Dumpling stew.

I, absolutely, love this recipe. It was super easy. I rolled my dumplings into little bowls and heavily seasoned them to add a magnitude of flavor. My family enjoyed it immensely. I pressure cooked some chicken to go with this so I could have homemade chicken and dumplings. We had some the following day and they DO NOT like leftovers. I plan on making these again one day.
Delicious! :-)

I actually cut the dumpling recipe in half. I am also all about flavors so I added half a teaspoon of black pepper, half a teaspoon of onion powder and half a teaspoon of garlic powder to the recipe. I rolled mine out and cut them and as the recipe said dusted them with a little extra flour which thickened the broth perfectly. Definitely would recommend this recipe!
like another commentor, i added butter to the recipe. i added to my chicken while it was boiling and it gave it that richer taste that i remember growing up. easy recipe and delish!

I have lost my grandmother's recipe, but this one is similar (I think the proportions were different) and it came out similar, if a bit bland by themselves. Keep to the reccomended size for cutting as these will swell while boiling, and watch them so they don't sink to the bottom and stick.
It worked out great

I substituted the flour for gluten free cup for cup flour, and it turned out fine. I just had to press the dough into patties because the GF flour didn't want to stick together. It cooked according to the recipe and hubby enjoyed it (also my picky eating princess), which is quite a plus!

If you like a rolled dumpling, these are great! I didn't think they were too salty at all. I cooked mine for about 8 or 9 minutes but should have gone at least 10. They still turned out super. Nice and tender.

I have been looking for a dumpling recipe that wouldn't dissolve when cooked. These held up beautifully. I made them with butter and all other ingredients as written. I rolled them and cut them with a pizza cutter. My search is over. This is my dumpling recipe.

These are good dumplings, but you can make it easier by getting refrigerated pie dough at the grocery.
I let mine set for ten minutes and lay out on a cutting board dusted with flour, dust some flour on top and then cut into strips.
Two crusts are included per box. I add both crusts to a chicken broth made with a half or whole chicken in a slow cooker.
Easy.
Very good dumplings!! Kids ate them up!
Made these for my husband's Men's Club potluck. They were wonderful! I'll definitely make them again! Next time I'll roll them a bit thinner, they did puff up quite a bit!
Easy and fast, great Dumplings

I had never tried making homemade dumplings before but these were super simple! I didn't have any shortening so used the same amount of solidified coconut oil instead and they still came out perfect. Melt in your mouth.
These are wonderful and easy to make. As another user commented they are very fluffy so roll them very thin. I used unsalted butter in place of the shortening and it worked out very well ??
I used this recipe all of the time. I have made it for several people, and it has always been a hit. I have to double to recipe, because there is never enough.

Turned out great. I doubled the broth and added two chopped up chicken thighs. Maybe cut the salt in half next time. I added 1/2 tsp of fine pepper and 1 tbsp of dried parsley. 3 of us and no left overs. Perfect meal for a snowy day.

These were perfect. I used butter flavor shortening, 3/4 t. salt and added black pepper. Put dough in fridge wrapped in plastic for few hours before rolling. Rolled extra thin, cut with pizza cutter into one inch squares, perfect.
way too doughy for me
I make this regularly it is my go to dumpling recipe for chicken and dumplings.

Best dumplings. I doubled the recipe and used 2 boxes of chicken broth. I sautéed some celery in butter with a teaspoon of poultry seasoning before adding the broth. 
My family secret for dumplings....roast the chicken and use some of the fat( schmaltz) in the dough. Never lift the lid until your dumplings are done.
Labeled broth and dumplings over shredded roasted chicken.
yummmmm! Great and easy peasy recipe that always turns out! Thanks for sharing it with the world!
Unbelievably quick, simple and perfect. Replaces drop dumplings in our house altogether. Thank you!

Very good - made the broth and added some diced celery and onions plus some shredded chicken. Have made it several times and it's a family favorite. I also use all butter and no shortening because I don't keep shortening on hand. Works great.
Perfect dumplings. I use this recipe for dumplings to make my chicken and dumplings. I make double the dumplings because they are just so darn yummy!
Very easy and perfect for the chicken soup I was making. I recommend rolling them as thin as possible for the best results.
I used to use can biscuts 'cause I'm a lazy 'ol cus, but after using this recipe, will never make 'em any other way. They need to be rolled thin, as others have stated and I add herbs. Terrific!
This sounded like it was closer to our family recipe than anything else I could find. I added one egg, reduced baking powder to 1.5 tsp, and milk to 1/3 cup, and it was perfect.

I've had this recipe saved since 2006. It's my very first recipe saved in my box on AllRecipes. My dad says it's the best Chicken & Dumplings he's ever had, and that's the highest of praise from an 83 year old Texas cowboy. Thank you for sharing this. I'm on my way to his house right now with a huge batch of it. He's been battling cancer for a year and just started chemo again, so I know he'll love it one more time.
These are not too fluffy, not too flat, they are just right!

This recipe is Awesome! Was at daughters decided to try this recipe had no shortening used all butter, didn't tell anyone that it wasn't my old standby recipe. They realized that I had done something different and they all loved them. Light and tender dumplings. Will use this again!
Always use this, I change it up depending on what I have or feel like but this is great place to start and or use as is.

I've made the dumplings from this website a least 100 times over the last few years. Okay, not really 100, but quite a few. They've turned out great EVERY single time!

I've only made a few changes. I double, or triple the recipe. I don't sprikle the dumplings lightly with flour, I coat liberally with flour which helps thicken the broth. I also usually add a whole chicken or a few chicken breasts. I use a few spoonfuls of Better than Boullion chicken flavoring to enhance the flavor too.

Delicious dumplings. I recommend rolling them out as thin as possible (around 1/8" or less) before cutting, or they will be too heavy. Rolling them out 1/16"-1/8" gives you a light, noodle-like dumpling. These are NOT the puffy, biscuit dumplings. These are dense and taste more like homemade pasta.

I rolled these as thin as I could and they still puffed up a bit. I cooked them in two batches and ended up needing more broth. Next time, I will use three cans of chicken broth and will cook them all at the same time rather than in batches. (I always add 1/4 tsp. poultry seasoning to the broth because I like that seasoning in my dumplings.) These had a good flavor.

Almost like Grandma used to make! She never measured anything, so her recipe is hard to follow. I made half a batch, except I used the full 1/2 cup milk. No problems rolling out. Mixed them up in my Little Oskar food processor. Definitely need to roll them thin. They were very good and I wanted more, but a half batch was plenty for two people.
Very easy to make and delicious. I used this dumpling with my leftover Thanksgiving turkey. I put a little of my leftover gravy in the stock. It made a thick yummy stew.

Unbelievable...just like moms!

I tried this recipe about 2 weeks ago with some chicken broth that I had made from left-over roasted chicken. My 76 year old mom came to dinner and raved about how the dumplings were better than her aunt's.

Last week I still had some of the chicken broth (with plenty of chicken in it) in the freezer and was hungry about 10 PM:) I didn't have any shortening so I substituted with 1/4 cup of bacon fat (I always keep left-over bacon fat in a cup in the fridge after I cook it)...it turned out "OFF THE HOOK!". The extra flavor from the bacon fat added another dimension!

I don't understand why people say that cooking can be so difficult. My secret is to cook a big piece of meat on Sunday (Chicken, beef, pork shoulder, etc.), then I have plenty of left-overs the rest of the week to be creative and fast with meals for my husband (tacos, enchiladas, pot-pies, soups, etc.). Get the major cooking out of the way with a big piece of meat on a not so busy day and the possibilities are endless!
I made this as written and found it too salty for my taste. I also had trouble with getting the dough to stick together but that's probably my lack of "dumpling" skill.

My daughter and I had a great time making these. They are so simple. We had butter flavored shortening, added some cracked pepper and onion powder. Delicious! They need to be cut thin if you want a noodle -like dumpling ( as she states, 1/8"). We are originally from the North so we don't mind the thicker 'dumpling'. Thanks for sharing this recipe with us. We were on a Sunday cooking roll!!
These dumplings cooked well and tasted great, but they were kind of heavy even though I rolled them out thinly. What could I do next time to make them fluffier inside?

Wonderfully delicious! I have tried other recipes from this site and I believe I have found my favorite recipe. After reading another reviewers comment about being too salty, I only added 1/2 tsp and they were great. Thank you, thank you!
I thought this recipe was spot on. It doubled easily too. I boiled three chicken breasts, with onions, peas and carrots in 2 quarts of chicken stock before adding the dumplings. Mmm!

I have made this recipe a few times now, and one thing that I don't like is that after 8-10 minutes the dumplings are still raw in the middle. It takes almost an hour for them to cook all the way through, and I do roll them thin. The flavor and texture are good after cooking, but they aren't close to done after 10 minutes. The other negative is the shortening. Nothing but hydrogenated oils. I will need to try it with butter, or even regular oil and see if it turns out. This recipe is a great starter, but not a 5 star recipe.
Very good recipe, I added 1 egg to my dumpling mix and 1/2 tsp. Tarragon flakes......good on a winter day.....
LOVE This recipe..reminds me of my father-in-laws! Love that they are dense and filling....
Best ever!! I added some dried herbs and rolled them out very thin. I used these in chicken and dumplings and they are awsome.
Delicious! However, i added less salt and tons of vegetables
I made these to cook in pork stock instead of chicken broth, and added fresh sage, rosemary and thyme from my garden. They came out excellent.
I did not care much for this recipe. I wanted them to taste like my moms, and they didn't. I'll keep trying though. They were rather mushy without much form.

My family loves these dumplings! I use them in my Chicken & Dumplings & they are a huge hit!
This recipe also makes the BEST biscuits!

PERFECT! Exactly like my Grandma's too. I used margarine instead for my first batch and it worked perfectly. Shortening is excellent too. Thanks for the tip to roll them extra thin - they puffed up to the right thickness. WONDERFUL! Thanks so much. :)

Make your own delicious broth, and your family will love these! Unless of course there is something about the texture they don't like. My husband isn't a soup man, but he loves this as do my little ones

When I read the recipe, I was thinking, ok, something this simple can't be that good. Ok, it was better than good it was GREAT. I used water instead of milk, b/c my daughter is allergic to milk. It turned out great, I added shredded cooked chicken thighs to ours. I will deffinately make this again!
This was my first time making dumplings and this recipe was delicious and easy. Thanks for a great recipe.
These were a hit in my house. They do need to be rolled thin or they puff up alot. I will be making them again.

Recipe turned out good with some minor adjustments. Mixed all ingredients together in mixer. Dough was clumpy and dry so I add enough milk to make to mix the dough well (wet dough appearance). Next I use a soup spoon. I scooped each dumpling up and rolled it in flour. Then I dropped the dumplings in boiling stock. when the dumplings start to get soft, they are done. Drop them in the crock pot or stew.

Notes: using a lid will make a mess. I never cover my soup pots. Same goes for making gnocci.
Wonderful!!!!!! I will be using this recipe any time I make dumplings in the future.

These are so easy to make and so much better than the drop type dumplings. I wound up having to make 4 batches for my chicken and dumplings because my family kept eating them all. I rolled them out pretty flat and used a pizza cutter to make small triangles then dropped them into the simmering liquid. They plumped up but didn't get overly large.
Ohhh, yummy yumm yumm. I just finished making these. I added the dumplings AND the broth/water I used to cook them in into my chicken soup. Sooo good. Will make again and again.
Great!
Great recipe! Used it for homemade chicken and dumplings. Got rave reviews from DH and the kids.

Excellent recipe! I added a bit of chopped parsley in the dough. Instead of rolling I tore the dough and spread it to thin rounds and tossed them right to the boiling pot of chicken soup. Super easy to make such a good winter soup on a cold night!

I followed the recipe exactly, but it was so hard to roll them out. My dough was very hard and crumbly. While mixing it, I could barely get it to hold together. I added about 1 more tblsp of milk and still almost impossible to roll. I must have done something wrong, but not sure what. I rolled them as best I could, added them to boiling stock and they turned out kind of gummy. I made them based on all the excellent reviews, so I must have done something wrong.

I'm a nanny for a family with 8 kids....I made a batch of chicken & dumplings using this recipe that should have left a ton of left overs! Needless to say there wasn't even a bite left the next day! I also took the advice of using half butter half shorting and I also used buttermilk for a lil extra flavor! These are soooo simple and packed full of flavor you can easily add any number of herbs & spices to suit the needs of any recipe you'd like to jazz up with an nice homemade county feel. Soooo yummy!

This recipe is easy as can be. I used butter flavored Crisco shortening. The chicken stock was very flavorful, which made the dumplings that much better. This is the first time I rolled dumplings and I will do these again!
Great! Just how I remembered!!

I wanted a quick dumpling soup recipe to use up the remaining cans of chicken broth I had from Thanksgiving. This dumpling recipe is GREAT as a quick soup. It only took 30 minutes tops and it was satisfying. I used 1 box and 3 cans of chicken broth, parsley flakes, shredded chicken breast (had extra chicken after I made quesadillas) salt and pepper. Boiled it. Made the dumplings and cooked until it's consistency was just like chicken and dumplings. It was delicious! My only complaint about this recipe is the dumplings weren't as firm as I like them. They were a bit soft and you can forget about them being solid to reheat them. Either way, these were great the way I made them and I WOULD give this recipe to a friend. Thanks for sharing, Jessica!
